SEARCH
Package com.serezk4.configuration

Class DatabaseConfiguration

java.lang.Object
com.serezk4.configuration.DatabaseConfiguration
public final class DatabaseConfiguration extends Object
Provides database configuration details for connecting to a PostgreSQL database.

The DatabaseConfiguration class retrieves connection details such as the URL, username, and password from environment variables. These details are used to establish a connection with the database.

Environment Variables:

  • DB_HOST: The hostname or IP address of the database server.
  • DB_PORT: The port number on which the database server is running.
  • DB_NAME: The name of the database to connect to.
  • DB_USER: The username for authentication.
  • DB_PASSWORD: The password for authentication.

Usage:

 String url = DatabaseConfiguration.POSTGRES_URL;
 String user = DatabaseConfiguration.POSTGRES_USER;
 String password = DatabaseConfiguration.POSTGRES_PASSWORD;

All fields are public static final, allowing direct access without creating an instance of the class.

Since:
1.0

  • Field Details

    • POSTGRES_URL

      public static final String POSTGRES_URL
      The JDBC URL for connecting to the PostgreSQL database.

      The URL is constructed using the DB_HOST, DB_PORT, and DB_NAME environment variables. It follows the format:

       jdbc:postgresql://:/

      Example:

       jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/mydatabase
      See Also:
      • PostgreSQL JDBC Connection

    • POSTGRES_USER

      public static final String POSTGRES_USER
      The username for connecting to the PostgreSQL database.

      Retrieved from the DB_USER environment variable.

    • POSTGRES_PASSWORD

      public static final String POSTGRES_PASSWORD
      The password for connecting to the PostgreSQL database.

      Retrieved from the DB_PASSWORD environment variable.
